titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 69: Miscellany of scientific treatises

notesStmt.note: Title supplied by cataloger; title written in Latin on upper cover is too abraded to be read easily.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Collection of scientific, alchemical, and medical works. Some are by famous individuals such as Geber, Albertus Magnus, and Johannes de Rupescissa, but most are unattributed. Partial table of contents in a later hand pasted inside upper cover. Many marginal notes, symbols, corrections and comments in various later cursive hands, including a reference to the date 1431 (f. 16r).

msItem.title: Miscellany of scientific treatises
Aqua philosophica atque occulta, f. 1r
Liber investigationum Gebri philosophii, f. 2r
Rosa novella, f. 10r
Vasa chemica, f. 14v
Liber investigationum Gebri de medicine proprietatibus sive investigationum perfecti magisterii, f. 23r
Practica magni philosophi, f. 34r
Opus universale, f. 44r
Philosophus perpulcer et nobilis quo ad veram viam universalem, f. 47r
Tractatus concordiarum philosophorum de lapide philosophico, f. 64r
Liber lucis, f. 75v
Universale quomodo corpora in primam materiam reducantur, f. 80r
Synonima corporum spirituum et salium cum signis, f. 93v
Tractatus utilis de materia et generatione metallorum, f. 102v
Passage concerning the four elements, f. 107v
Ad rubeum, f. 108r
Tractatus perpulcer de generatione et corruptione metallorum collectus, f. 109r
De putrefactione, f. 116v
Dialogus in miseros et stolidos alchymistas, f. 119v
Additional notes and recipes in another hand, f. 120v

support.watermark: Piccard XIII. iii. 1638 (ca. 1483); also, cf. Piccard IV. xii. 252 and 253 (ca. 1487 and 1488).

supportDesc.extent: 123 leaves : 207 x 140 (148 x 85) mm. bound to 215 x 145 mm

collation.p: Paper, i + 123 + i; 1¹², 2-7¹⁰, 8¹⁰(+1), 9-12¹⁰; 1-75, [i], 76-122; contemporary foliation in ink, upper right recto. Gatherings signed a-i, k-m, lower right recto of leaves in first half of each gathering.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 26-29 long lines; ruled in lead.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a Gothic cursive script in a single hand, with a second, slightly later hand beginning on f. 120v.

decoDesc.decoNote: Diagram of alchemical devices (f. 22v); sketches in ink of crowns (f. 9v, 23r); 4-line and 5-line puzzle initials in red and green (f. 2r, 47r), alternating green or red initials and paragraph marks throughout; red underlining throughout; various chemical and alchemical symbols used in the text and marginalia.

binding.p: Contemporary boards with remains of bronze clasp; rebacked with 19th-century morocco; spine is worn, particularly at the hinges. Title (abraded) written on upper cover. The second and last quires and the front endleaf are pulling loose. A few leaves are torn.

origin.p: Written in Germany, in the third quarter of the 15th century (Zacour-Hirsch).

history.provenance: Possibly formerly owned by Richard Heber (inscription referring to Heber's sale, f. [i] recto).
Formerly owned by Georg Franz Burkhard Kloss (Frankfurt am Main); sold at auction at Sotheby's to Rodd, 7 May 1835, lot 4567.
Formerly owned by George T. Strong (signature, dated 1839, f. [i] recto); sold at auction at Bangs & Co., 4 Nov. 1878, lot 1061.
Formerly owned by Henry Charles Lea (signature, dated 1878, f. [i] recto; bookplate inside lower cover).
Passed to the University of Pennsylvania with the Lea Library.

keywords.term: Medicine, Magic, mystic, and spagiric--Early works to 1800
